title: NetSuite – Staff Business Systems Analyst
content:
About Us
With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world’s leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.
Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.
At ChargePoint, we foster a positive and productive work environment by committing to live our values of Be Courageous, Charge Together, Love our Customers, Operate with Openness, and Relentlessly Pursue Awesome. These values guide how we show up every day, align, and work together to build a brighter future for all of us.
Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.
Discover what it’s like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.
Reports To
Senior Director – BizApps Engineering
What You Will Be Doing
As a NetSuite Business Systems Analyst, you’ll play a crucial role in an organization by utilizing your expertise in both business processes and the NetSuite software platform. Their primary responsibilities typically include:

System Analysis: Analyzing business requirements and processes to identify how NetSuite can be leveraged to meet the organization's needs
Implementation and Customization: Configuring and customizing NetSuite to align with business processes, which may involve setting up workflows, custom fields, forms, and reports
Integration: Collaborating with IT teams to integrate NetSuite with other systems and applications used within the organization
Troubleshooting and Support: In addition to core solutioning responsibilities, you may need providing technical support, addressing user issues, and troubleshooting system problems related to NetSuite – on need basis
Training and Documentation: Conducting training sessions for end-users to ensure they understand how to effectively use NetSuite and creating documentation for processes and procedures
Continuous Improvement: Identifying opportunities for improvement in system functionalities, performance, and user experience
System Upgrades and Maintenance: Managing upgrades, updates, and patches for NetSuite to ensure the system is up-to-date and functioning optimally
Data Management: Overseeing data integrity, ensuring accurate data entry, and managing data migration processes
Business Process Optimization: Collaborating with different departments to streamline processes and workflows, utilizing NetSuite's capabilities effectively
Project Management: Leading or participating in projects related to NetSuite implementation or enhancement, ensuring they are delivered on time and within scope
Coordinate solution and development activities  within the development team

What You Will Bring to ChargePoint

NetSuite Configuration and Implementation: Configuring and customizing the NetSuite system to meet the specific needs of the organization. This involves understanding business requirements, conducting system analysis, and implementing solutions within NetSuite
Financial Management: Utilizing NetSuite for financial functions such as accounting, financial reporting, budgeting, and financial planning. This involves understanding financial principles, ensuring accurate financial data within the system, and generating financial reports
Supply Chain Management: Understanding and optimizing supply chain processes within NetSuite. This includes managing inventory, procurement, order fulfillment, demand planning, and logistics. The analyst may be responsible for ensuring smooth operations, improving efficiency, and reducing costs within the supply chain
Business Process Improvement: Analyzing existing business processes and recommending improvements or new features within NetSuite to enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and support business growth
User Training and Support: Providing training to users within the organization on how to use NetSuite effectively. Also offering ongoing support and troubleshooting for any system-related issues
Data Analysis and Reporting: Using NetSuite to extract, analyze, and present data for informed decision-making. Generating reports and dashboards that offer insights into various aspects of the business, including supply chain and financial performance
Collaboration and Communication: Collaborating with different teams, such as IT, finance, supply chain, and other departments, to gather requirements, understand business needs, and ensure that NetSuite aligns with the overall business objectives
Compliance and Security: Ensuring that NetSuite configurations and processes comply with industry standards, regulations, and security protocols, especially concerning financial data and supply chain security
System Maintenance and Upgrades: Managing system upgrades, patches, and enhancements in NetSuite to keep the system up-to-date and functioning optimally
Documentation and Best Practices: Documenting configurations, processes, and best practices for using NetSuite effectively. This documentation aids in training, troubleshooting, and maintaining the system

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in business, Finance, or a related field
7-10+ years of experience as a NetSuite Administrator or similar role with Supply Chain and finance functional knowledge
Strong understanding of accounting principles and financial processes including revenue (ARC 606) management
Strong understanding of supply-chain / order fulfillment functions in NetSuite
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team.
Proactive and self-motivated with a focus on continuous improvement
Ability to work with a global team in business and within the bizapps
Be the bridge and coordinate project enhancement between business ops and offshore development
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, with attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality solutions
Salesforce and quote to cash functional knowledge is highly preferable

Location
Campbell, CA
ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. 
The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $70,000 to $150,750. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location. 
We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.
If there is a match between your experiences/skills and the Company needs, we will contact you directly.
ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants only - Recruiting agencies do not contact.
 
#LI-JH1
